pageContext.claim: “We have a trade deficit with Canada. We have a big imbalance of at least $17 billion. And with Mexico, we have an imbalance, we have a trade deficit of $71 billion, and I believe that number is really much higher than that.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has a habit of using trade figures that include only goods, not services. The U.S. trade deficit with Canada for goods was $12.1 billion in 2016, but there was a trade surplus with Canada for services of $24.6 billion in 2016 -- so the United States actually had a $12 billion trade surplus with Canada that year. The 2016 trade deficit with Mexico was $56 billion.
